item.title: Aubrey Plaza said she was 'proud' of husband Jeff Baena in last Instagram post before his death - The Mirror US
item.description:
Aubrey Plaza said she was 'proud' of husband in last post before his death

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: The Mirror

Aubrey Plaza expressed her affection and pride for her husband Jeff Baena in an Instagram post just before his untimely death at 47.

  • Jeff Baena was found dead in their Los Angeles home on Friday.
  • Aubrey's last Instagram post in May 2021 highlighted her pride in Jeff's movie projects.
  • Law enforcement continues to investigate the cause of Jeff's death.
  • Tributes from fans express condolences and sadness over his passing.
“So proud of my darling husband @jeffbaena for dreaming up another film that takes us to Italia to cause some more trouble,” said Aubrey in her last post.

This tragic event highlights the sudden loss that can impact loved ones. Aubrey's heartfelt words bring attention to the profound relationships we cherish.

item.title: Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers - The Indian Express
item.description:
Why Modi govt 3.0 is maintaining an arm’s length from protesting farmers

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has indicated a distant approach from the ongoing farmers' protests led by the Samyukta Kisan Morcha and Kisan Mazdoor Morcha, unlike the proactive measures taken during Modi's previous term.

  • Farmers have been protesting since February 2024 at the Punjab-Haryana borders, demanding legal status for Minimum Support Price (MSP) and a farm debt waiver.
  • Chouhan has extended an open invitation for talks, yet has not engaged directly with the protesting farmers.
  • The government's previous attempts to resolve farmer grievances, particularly in 2020-21, led to escalated tensions and prolonged protests.
  • Current protests are more localized and lack the broad unity seen in earlier movements.
  • Jagjit Singh Dallewal, president of BKU Sidhupur, is on a hunger strike demanding response to farmers' issues from the government.
“Currently, the Supreme Court is looking into this issue. Whatever directives the Supreme Court gives, will be followed.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

This current strategy marks a significant shift in the government's handling of farmer-related issues, emphasizing a more detached stance in contrast to previous direct engagements.

item.title: Atul Subhash suicide case: Wife Nikita Singhania, her mother and brother get bail - The Times of India
item.description:
Nikita Singhania, Family Granted Bail in Atul Subhash Suicide Case

Date: January 4, 2025
Source: Times of India

Nikita Singhania, the wife of Atul Subhash who allegedly committed suicide, along with her mother and brother, have been granted bail in the case. The Mumbai Sessions Court granted them bail on Tuesday, January 3, 2025.

  • The court set a bail bond of Rs 10,000 each for Nikita and her family.
  • The court also imposed certain conditions, including that they do not leave the country without prior permission and that they cooperate with the investigation.

The court observed that the accused are not likely to abscond and will cooperate with the investigation.

The next hearing in the case is scheduled for February 15, 2025.

item.title: Space42's Thuraya 4 Satellite Successfully Launched Into Orbit - PR Newswire
item.description:
Space42's Thuraya 4 Satellite Successfully Launched Into Orbit

Publication Date: /PRNewswire/

Space42 has successfully launched its Thuraya 4 telecommunications satellite into orbit aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral, Florida. This satellite aims to enhance connectivity across multiple regions and support upcoming products in Space42’s portfolio.

  • Thuraya 4 offers secure capacity, faster speeds, and wider coverage across Africa, Europe, Central Asia, and the Middle East.
  • The launch is a crucial step in Space42's plan to introduce 15 new products.
  • The satellite was deployed at 20:26 Eastern Time and will take months to reach its operational orbit.
His Excellency Mansoor Al Mansoori, Chairman of Space42, stated: "The successful launch of Thuraya 4 is a testament to our commitment to push innovation boundaries and strengthen the UAE's leadership in the SpaceTech sector globally."

The launch highlights Space42's ambition to reshape connectivity and contribute to the UAE's National Space Strategy 2030.

item.title: ‘India well-prepared’: On HMPV, govt says situation in China is not unusual - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India's Preparedness Against Rising Respiratory Illnesses Amid China's HMPV Cases

Date: Jan 04, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Union health ministry reassures the public that India is well-prepared to handle respiratory infections as reports of HMPV cases in China rise. The ministry describes the situation as not unusual.

  • A Joint Monitoring Group meeting was held to assess the rising respiratory illness cases.
  • Experts from WHO, IDSP, and other organizations participated in the deliberations.
  • The ministry attributes the surge to seasonal pathogens such as Influenza virus, RSV, and HMPV.
  • No significant increase in Influenza Like Illness (ILI) or Severe Acute Respiratory Illness (SARI) cases in India.
  • ICMR will enhance testing for HMPV and monitor trends throughout the year.
  • Health systems are described as vigilant and prepared for any health challenges.
"There is nothing to be alarmed about in the present situation." - Dr. Atul Goel, DGHS

In summary, India's health infrastructure is well-equipped to manage any respiratory illness increases, ensuring public health safety during the flu season.

item.title: Weather news live: Delhi witnesses season's longest zero visibility spell on Saturday, says IMD - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Experiences Longest Zero Visibility Spell of the Season

Date: January 4, 2025   Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi witnessed a nine-hour stretch of zero visibility on Saturday, the longest of the season, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). This severe weather condition resulted in significant disruptions to flight and train operations.

  • Flight operations at Delhi airport were severely impacted, with 91 trains delayed and 400 flights affected.
  • IndiGo and Air India temporarily halted arrivals and departures due to thick fog.
  • The IMD recorded zero visibility for nine hours at Palam and eight hours at Safdarjung.
  • Dense fog also affected visibility in other regions like Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh.
"Zero visibility prevailed for nine hours at Palam between 6 pm and 3 am (UTC), marking the longest spell of the season," stated the IMD.

This unusual weather phenomenon has drawn attention to the ongoing cold wave affecting many parts of northern India, prompting advisories from airlines and the government to ensure safety and manage operations effectively.

item.title: 'Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy': PM Modi - News18
item.description:
Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy

Date: January 04, 2025   Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that the Indian government's initiatives are energizing rural India, aiming to empower communities and transform villages into hubs of growth.

  • PM Modi spoke at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025, celebrating rural India's resilience.
  • He highlighted increasing accessibility to healthcare services in rural areas.
  • An approximate Rs. 3 lakh crore in financial assistance has been provided to farmers under the PM-KISAN scheme.
“During the COVID pandemic, the world doubted how Indian villages would tackle the crisis, but we ensured vaccines reached the last person in every village.” – PM Modi

The Prime Minister's remarks reflect ongoing government efforts to enhance rural infrastructure and economic stability, aiming for a 'Viksit Bharat' (Developed India) by 2047.

item.title: Govt grants pharma industry 12-month extension for implementing revised Schedule M - The Economic Times
item.description:
Government Proposes Extension for Pharma Industry Compliance Deadline

Publication Date: Saturday, January 4, 2023

Source: Economic Times

The government has issued a draft notification proposing to extend the deadline for compliance with the revised Schedule M in the pharmaceutical sector, responding to industry concerns regarding infrastructure upgrades.

  • The deadline extension is aimed at small and medium manufacturers with a turnover of less than 250 crores.
  • Manufacturers can apply for an extension until December 31, 2025, by submitting an upgrade plan.
  • Nearly half of the 10,000 drug manufacturing units face challenges in meeting the current compliance deadline.
  • The revised Schedule M requires improvements in manufacturing practices and quality management systems.
  • The government has acknowledged the industry's call for a two-year extension due to procurement delays and other challenges.
“We have liberalised our scheme to specifically help the MSME upgrade their quality standards to revised Schedule M.” - Arunish Chawla, Former DoP Secretary

This notification will be finalized after public comments are considered within the next seven days.

item.title: Struggling with 'this' while brushing? It could be a sign of dementia - The Times of India
item.description:
Struggling with 'this' while brushing? It could be a sign of dementia

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: [Insert Source]

This article discusses how difficulty in performing everyday tasks, such as brushing teeth, may indicate dementia, particularly a condition known as apraxia.

  • Apraxia refers to the inability to perform learned motor tasks despite the individual wanting to and being physically able to do so.
  • Dr. Richard Restak emphasizes recognizing small changes early for timely care and support.
  • The article outlines the "Four A’s" of Alzheimer's: Amnesia, Aphasia, Agnosia, and Apraxia.
  • Amnesia includes memory loss and confusion, often seen in early stages of dementia.
  • Aphasia affects language skills, causing difficulties in communication.
  • Agnosia refers to trouble recognizing familiar objects or people.
  • Caregivers can significantly support individuals by breaking tasks into simpler steps and ensuring a safe environment.
“A person with apraxia may be able to recognise and even name a toothbrush and toothpaste but may be unable to carry out the act of squeezing the toothpaste onto the toothbrush.” - Dr. Richard Restak

Early detection and understanding of these signs can improve the quality of life for those with Alzheimer's and their caregivers.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing On Tuesday: Latest GMP Signals Over 43% Listing Gain For Investors - News18
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Signals Strong Listing Gain Ahead of January 7

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: News18

Unlisted shares of Indo Farm Equipment Ltd are currently trading at ₹308, a rise of ₹93 or 43.26% from the IPO issue price of ₹215, indicating a strong anticipated listing on January 7.

  • Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment was finalized recently.
  • Latest Grey Market Premium (GMP) stands at 43.26%.
  • The IPO received a 227.67x overall subscription rate.
  • The price band for the IPO was set between ₹204 and ₹215.
‘Grey market premium’ indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.

This IPO is expected to show promising returns for investors with its strong subscription numbers and favorable trading signals ahead of its listing.

item.title: Manipur Governor reviews security, tribal body extends shutdown - The Hindu
item.description:
Manipur Governor reviews security, tribal body extends shutdown

Date: January 04, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla reviewed the state's security situation following violent protests and ongoing ethnic tensions in the region.

  • Governor Bhalla met with senior police and military officials to assess security arrangements.
  • The Committee on Tribal Unity extended a shutdown in Kuki-Zo areas protesting against perceived neglect of tribal rights.
  • A mob attacked the Superintendent of Police's office, injuring several, including the district's police chief.
  • The government proposed constructing 15,000 houses for those displaced by ongoing ethnic conflict.
“The CoTU is perturbed by the action of the Superintendent of Police... This extended shutdown reflects the people’s growing anger and disappointment,” a Committee spokesperson said.

The situation in Manipur remains tense as ethnic clashes continue, highlighting the urgent need for resolution and improved security measures.

item.title: 'Take it away, give me Rs 25 lakh per day instead': Prashant Kishor on row over vanity van at BPSC protes - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Take it away, give me Rs 25 lakh per day instead’: Prashant Kishor on row over vanity van at BPSC protest site

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a controversial statement made at a recent protest site for the Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC), Prashant Kishor, a prominent political strategist, expressed his disdain over the provision of a vanity van, suggesting that the amount spent on it could instead be given to him daily.

  • Kishor openly criticized the unnecessary expenditure during the protest.
  • He highlighted the disparity between luxury comforts and the real issues faced by protestors.
  • The statement has sparked debate regarding priorities in political demonstrations.
“Take it away, give me Rs 25 lakh per day instead,” Kishor remarked.

This incident reflects ongoing tensions in Bihar's political sphere and raises questions about resource allocation in protest situations.

item.title: BPSC exam row: ‘Vanity van’ near Prashant Kishor’s protest site in Patna sparks controversy - The Hindu
item.description:
Controversy Over 'Vanity Van' at Prashant Kishor’s Protest in Patna

Published Date: January 04, 2025

Source: The Hindu

Controversy erupted on January 4, 2025, over a 'vanity van' parked near the protest site of Prashant Kishor in Patna, where he is conducting a hunger strike over allegations of a questioned paper leak in the BPSC exam.

  • The vanity van, equipped with luxury facilities, raised eyebrows as it was located close to Gandhi Maidan, where Kishor's protest commenced on January 2, 2025.
  • Kishor highlighted the discrepancy between his protest and the lavish amenities, questioning the significance of restroom facilities compared to the future of BPSC aspirants.
  • A legal protest notice was issued by the district administration claiming the gathering was illegal as per a High Court order.
  • Over the last three weeks, several demonstrators have been actively advocating for a cancellation of the examination.
“I want to convey this through mediapersons... let this van be taken away and in return, give me ₹25 lakh per day and provide an alternate space that can be used as a washroom.” - Prashant Kishor

The situation surrounding Mr. Kishor's protest continues to be contentious, with authorities warning of actions against him and his supporters.

item.title: Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know - News18
item.description:
Zepto IPO: Company To File Draft Papers In March-April; All You Need To Know

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 19:32 IST

Quick commerce platform Zepto is gearing up to file its initial public offering (IPO) draft papers by March or April 2025, according to a report by The Economic Times. The company has permission to relocate its base from Singapore to India ahead of the public listing.

  • A critical board meeting on January 19 will finalise aspects of the IPO, including the appointment of bankers and determining the IPO size.
  • Data on the grey market premium will be available once the IPO process starts.
  • Zepto will become the first quick commerce startup to go public if successful.
  • Zepto is transitioning to a marketplace model, registered as Zepto Marketplace in October 2024.
  • Zepto raised USD 350 million in funding in November 2024 and plans to expand to over 50 cities.
“Zepto reported a 120 per cent increase in operating revenue to Rs 4,454 crore in FY24.”

The IPO process marks a significant step for Zepto as it seeks to expand and solidify its position in the quick commerce market.

item.title: Rare celestial event: Moon flanked by Venus and Saturn in stunning alignment over India - India Today
item.description:
Moon flanked by Venus and Saturn in stunning alignment over India

Publication Date: Jan 4, 2025

Source: India Today

Stargazers across India are in for a dazzling treat as the Moon, Venus, and Saturn align in a rare celestial event tonight. This planetary conjunction offers a breathtaking view of these three celestial bodies converging shortly after sunset.

  • TheWaxing crescent Moon will shine alongside Venus and Saturn.
  • The alignment will be visible around 8:30 p.m.
  • No specialized equipment is needed to view this event.
  • Best viewed in areas with minimal light pollution.
  • Astrophotographers are encouraged to capture this rare alignment.
“Whether you’re an avid astronomer or a casual stargazer, tonight’s celestial display is an opportunity to reconnect with the wonders of the universe.”

Don't miss this unique opportunity to witness the beauty of our solar system, as this celestial event is part of a larger series of astronomical occurrences scheduled for January 2025.

item.title: With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots - The Indian Express
item.description:
With Jasprit Bumrah watching from on the field and off it, ‘captain’ Virat Kohli calls the shots

Publication Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Virat Kohli displayed strong leadership on the field during the Test match against Australia, stepping up as captain while Jasprit Bumrah dealt with a back spasm. Despite some initial missteps, Kohli managed the field positions and worked closely with bowlers to maintain pressure on the Australia batting lineup.

  • Kohli initially occupied the wrong slip position but quickly corrected it.
  • After Bumrah left the field, Kohli took over field placements and animatedly directed play.
  • He provided encouragement and strategic advice to bowlers like Prasidh Krishna and Mohammad Siraj.
  • Kohli celebrated the team's successes and maintained high energy throughout the innings.
“They are new boys. I know they should be given responsibility. But let them earn it.” - Rohit Sharma

Kohli's performance highlighted his experience and dedication, as he effectively managed the team's strategy even in Bumrah's absence.

item.title: 'When I got to know Adrija Roy is new Raahi..': Anupamaa's Spreha Chatterjee on actress being roped in show - India Forums
item.description:
‘When I got to know Adrija Roy is new Raahi..': Anupamaa's Spreha Chatterjee on actress being roped in show

Published: Saturday, January 4, 2025 at 1:34 PM

Spreha Chatterjee, who plays Maahi in Star Plus' Anupamaa, speaks about Adrija Roy replacing Alisha Parveen on the show.

  • Spreha expressed her surprise and pleasure upon learning that Adrija Roy was the one replacing Raahi.
  • She described her first meeting with Adrija on set, highlighting the positive atmosphere and openness of the team.
  • Adrija Roy took over the role following Alisha Parveen's ousting due to performance issues.
  • Adrija made a statement on the audience's attachment to characters and the adjustment period required when replacements are made.

First I got to know that Raahi is being replaced and when I got to know it is Adrija so obviously aap jab kisi ko jaante ho toh lagta hai chalo koi aisa insaan aaraha hai jisse main mil chuki hoon, kaam kar chuki hoon, toh acha laga ke Adrija show mein aarahi hai

- Spreha Chatterjee

This shift in casting is significant as it reflects the challenges actors face in gaining audience acceptance in established roles.

item.title: Janhvi Kapoor kicks off 2025 with her alleged boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, seeking blessings at Tirupati - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Janhvi Kapoor Kicks Off 2025 with Alleged Boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya at Tirupati

Date: January 1, 2025

Source: Times of India

This article covers the first outing of actress Janhvi Kapoor in 2025, where she was seen with her rumored boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya at the Tirupati temple. The couple sought blessings for the New Year.

  • Janhvi and Shikhar were seen together seeking blessings at the Tirupati temple.
  • The outing marks a significant public appearance for the couple as they start the new year together.
“We are excited for what 2025 has to offer!” - Janhvi Kapoor

Starting the new year with spirituality, Janhvi Kapoor and Shikhar Pahariya’s visit to Tirupati highlights their relationship and aims for blessings as they embark on 2025.

item.title: Cooking garlic and onions at high heat can add trans fats to your meal; here's how - The Times of India
item.description:
Cooking Garlic and Onions at High Heat Can Create Trans Fats: Here’s What You Need to Know

Publication Date: 2023-10-01 Source: The Times of India

This article discusses the risks associated with cooking garlic and onions at high temperatures, which can convert beneficial compounds into trans fats, posing heart health risks.

  • Cooking garlic and onions above 140 °C may create harmful trans fats.
  • Trans fats are linked to serious health issues including heart disease.
  • Research shows that certain sulfur compounds in these vegetables contribute to the formation of trans fats when heated.
  • The World Health Organization advises keeping trans fat intake to less than 1% of total daily energy consumption.
“Release of TFAs under normal cooking conditions is expected to be minimal. Therefore, excessive caution is unnecessary,” states Dr. Honda.

Being mindful of cooking temperatures for garlic and onions can help reduce trans fat intake and promote heart health.
